summary:
As a young child growing up, I developed a love for all things Engineering. I would often try to open small machines to see why they function the way they did, this fascination propelled me to invest my time in deep study of further mathematics, physics, chemistry, and introductory technology, and subsequently in applying for and obtaining a bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering. I am positive soul and sure facilitator who would always choose progress with its attendant uncertainties than stagnation or status quo. I have always viewed life as a glass half-filled with so many opportunities coming my way to make a positive difference, challenges and difficulties abound, but they only served to bring out optimal results from me.
I desire to lead a life of research in Mechanics/Material design, Tribology, nanoscience, Experimental Physics, in the process inquiring, coordinating and associating natural laws for the implementing novel solutions that serves humanity. I am not above charity work, I shall give back to humanity in every way possible.

awards.title: Scholar Of Mechanical Engineering Class of 2010/2011
awards.description: In Recognition of my effort in coordinating and Teaching tutorial classes in Thermodynamics, Control Systems and Fluid Mechanics to Final Year students of the Department of Mechanical Engineering.

projects.title: Characterizing the materials of the anode and cathode electrodes of a Proton Exchange membrane fuel
projects.description:
1.Establishing that Membrane Electrode Assembly (MEA) efficiently conducts the electrons liberated at anode to the cathode of the Polymer Electrolyte fuel cell (PEMFC) and measuring the conductance, Gas permeance and Electro-Osmotic properties of MEA as a function of temperature.
2.  Mastering the MEA Production methods, namely Catalyst Coated Membrane Process and the Catalyst coated Substrate process.
3.Chemical Vapor Deposition of Platinum Catalyst layer on membrane
4.Carrying out a heat and Mass flow balance on a demonstrational PEMFC.
5.Observation of increase in current density of MEA with increase in temperature.

I also learnt that anode degradation phenomena in solid oxide electrolysers occurs across electrode/electrolyte interfaces, the partial pressure of oxygen ensures strontium (Sr) segregation forming strontium Oxide (SrO) on the surface, this leads to unwanted secondary phases SrZrO3 or La2Zr2O7.  Consequently, delamination, chemical and catalytic instability of anode material results.

projects.title: Surface Enhanced Raman BioSensor
projects.description:
In this Project, an immunoassay based on surface enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) was used to investigate SARs-CoV-2 antibody for its characteristic Raman fingerprint. Characterization of SERS substrate like Nano porous gold, gold nanoparticles deposited on topaz and coated on borosilicate glass showed a decent Plasmon enhancement factor of about 103 to 104 , it was also observed on all SERS substrate that a 1µm root mean square roughness height of deposited nanoparticles was sufficient for SERS enhancement. 
The immobilization of the Genetex SARs-CoV-2 was done using Cysteamine hydrochloride and Lomants reagent, linkage was only possible only after sufficient cleaning was effected on the SERS substrates, the Raman spectrum obtained was same for both protocols, however noise and substrate instability was observed. The presence of Cysteamine Hydrochloride monolayers was confirmed by the Raman peaks 510, 643, 726, 938, 1015, 2557, 2928, and 2962cm−1 each respectively assigned to ν(S − S), ν(C − S), ν(C − S), ν(C − C(−N)), ν(C − C(−N)), ν(S − H), νas(CH2) and νs(CH2). 
The characteristic disulfide band, Aliphatic and Aromatic bands, Amide I and Amide III bands were identified for both linking protocols and tentatively assigned.  Worthy of note is the detection of different conformation of thiol on the surface of the glass slide, since adsorption of the thiol monolayers was from solution a Langmuir growth model is proposed as the means of thiol growth and orientation.

profile_positions.description:

Design of control mechanics against vibration and environmental disturbance.

Calculation of Optimal Riblet size and experimental validation.

Modeling and Characterizing Non-linear vibrations of Riblet Imprinting Mechanism head.
Determination of Drive Regime for Riblet mechanism head
Design and Fabrication of Wind turbine blade Leading Edge Protection Contouring smoothing mechanism.
Rapid Prototyping of parts for precision mechanism using a 3D printer.
Design Leading Edge coatings and precision mechanism for application.
Documentation of Research and design milestones.
Designing a Predictive model to detective riblets tolerance during fabrication

company.name: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints

volunteer_experiences.description:
I spent about 60 to 80 hours per week engaging in Religious and Social service to a community of beautiful people in Calabar and Awka-Ibom Regions of Nigeria.
My Activities Included: All African service project(A detailed sanitation outreach for communities)
                                     Teaching Moral Doctrines to Communities especially the youth.
                                      Sharing religious books, tracts and publications to people.
                                     Delivering Food Items and Other essential humanitarian Items to the needy. 
                                     Building Love and Cohesion Amongst people of different backgrounds.
                                     Coordinating the Financial and Administrative welfare of fellow missionaries
